reviews.review: It's nothing special but it's not nothing either.
A pretty boring addition to the series that adds very little.

Half Life Blue Shift, I actually finished this today, which means, I finished the whole singleplayer expansions and Half Life 1 in General. To be honest, Blue Shift was enjoyable enough. I liked the same variety of enemies from Half Life 1 in this game. It was pretty short, which is alright for me.

It's a different point of view of the Black Mesa incident and I love the different times you encounter freeman through out the side story.

Much like Half-Life: Opposing Force, this expansion pack is set during the events of Half-Life 1. This time you're playing as a security guard named Barney Calhoun who, like Gordon Freeman, happens to be a witness to the Resonance Cascade, and much like Gordon, Barney must fight his way through the HECU Marines and the Xen aliens.

Not much new toys are given to you, and the only real gameplay change I could think of was that you can't use HEV charging stations, but its still very fun. Guns are still great, and enemies are still fun to fight. As always, when the music plays, its great. It is a rather short game though, so I recommend getting it on sale.

BARNEY CLONE NUMBER #123115421231
end of the line for you

This game is like Episode One. It's important to the storyline but it's not a so well done game.
I still recommend it.
You're playing as Barney Calhoun while occasionally seeing Gordon Freeman in Black Mesa.It's short, sweet and re-playable.

The beginning was pretty strong- wished they committed to a more darkened horror esque game with stricter ammo management. As it was, after reaching the surface everything got pretty easy and the security guard armor is op against HECU.

Fun time for the price, but not good enough to get the G-man's attention.

It's... not bad. But it's so old it hurts to play. Definitely a play for Half-Life fans, but don't expect a truly great Half-Life story.

A lot of people rat on Blue Shift, but I actually really like it. So much so that I might even say I like it more than base Half-Life 1. Compared to HL1, Blue Shift is easier and more simple, and there is a lot less wandering around and being confused by the janky puzzles. Unlike HL1, the zen section is actually a lot of fun, albeit short like the rest of the game. It is a short campaign, it only took me about 3.5 hours to beat my first time, but the whole experience was a lot of fun. The story of Blue-Shift parallels its gameplay, being more simple than HL1 but still fun and consistent. Overall I like Half-Life: Blue Shift and I definitely recommend buying it.
104 minutes of barney i can't get  back

This is a really good dlc. Its half life but from a different angle, and it connects to the universe really well, just like opposing force, but I like the difficulty (on normal) more than before, it seems a bit more balanced and I didnt have to save so often because the checkpoints are pretty fair, fairer than in opposing force or hl 1. Not like the difficulty was really bad in the other two, i just like it a bit more in this one. Good dlc!
